Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (13 ll.) and names of 12 witnesses on verso. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Farming lease for 3 months granted by Kalibis daughter of ... to the inhabitant of Philae Pelaias son of Aromgous. Date. year 12 Mechir 25 of Ptol. Philometor".
Curator's comments: Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT. Text 6 in Shore's Manuscript Catalogue of Demotic Gebelein Papyri in the British Museum. Publication in progress (C J Martin).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (325) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/325)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1986 Jun-Oct, Carmarthen Museum, A son of Luxor's Sands
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape Binding: copydex self adhesive carpet tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: fair
